channel.title: Compiler Error
channel.description: Whenever I try to run my compiler it says 'cannot find the path specified'

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @J_for_jawsh J for jawsh
item.description:
@J_for_jawsh wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:13, topic:410675”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=511949.msg3715272#msg3715272 date=1313600560]
32 bit:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_#YOUR CURRENT JDK HERE(without the #)\bin\javac.exe *.java

64 bit:

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_#YOUR CURRENT JDK HERE(without the #)\bin\javac.exe *.java

[/quote]

If you looked, he’s running 1.7 not 1.6[/quote]

I uninstalled JDK 7, and reinstalled 1.6 to solve the 7 problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @J_for_jawsh J for jawsh
item.description:
@J_for_jawsh wrote:

[quote=“Tension Ltd, post:10, topic:410675”][quote author=stooks link=topic=511949.msg3715225#msg3715225 date=1313598888]
that is what i am using also, it works fine for me…yeh try to use the updated version of jdk when possible
[/quote]

yeah, and his jdk is written out differently which maybe the rpoblem, you should try to write out like this jdk1.6.0_26 and change the 26 to your version but since you said you upgraded , it should be written jdk1.7.0_1< the 1 is for the version, I believe that but i do not know for sure.[/quote]

Still the same error using jdk1.7.0_1

Read full topic

that is what i am using also, it works fine for me…yeh try to use the updated version of jdk when possible

yeah, and his jdk is written out differently which maybe the rpoblem, you should try to write out like this jdk1.6.0_26 and change the 26 to your version but since you said you upgraded , it should be written jdk1.7.0_1< the 1 is for the version, I believe that but i do not know for sure.

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @J_for_jawsh J for jawsh
item.description:
@J_for_jawsh wrote:

[quote=“stooks, post:8, topic:410675”][quote author=Tension Ltd link=topic=511949.msg3715222#msg3715222 date=1313598781]
lol this is weird because usually the jdk is written out like this, jdk1.6.0_26 , maybe try to update to the new version, idk, sorry
[/quote]

that is what i am using also, it works fine for me…yeh try to use the updated version of jdk when possible[/quote]

I’m using JDK 7. That’s the most updated one, so I need to downgrade and do JDK 26?

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @J_for_jawsh J for jawsh
item.description:
@J_for_jawsh wrote:

[quote=“xXxSkillerxXx, post:5, topic:410675”]Try this

[quote]Title YOURSERVERCOMPILER
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.1.7_0\bin\javac.exe”*.java
pause[/quote][/quote]

I got this error after I did what you said.

'C:/Program is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @J_for_jawsh J for jawsh
item.description:
@J_for_jawsh wrote:

Tension Ltd:

Edit the compiler and put your jdk version there.

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.1.7_0\bin\javac.exe” -d ./Class/ Java/.java Java/sign/.java
pause

Already did

Read full topic
